channel.title: Clean source and client
channel.description:
Hello!
Im going to code a rsps from "scratch" (not really from scratch, i want the source to be stable and have working skills/working combat etc.) But no npc's added anywhere, nothing.
SO, i want a source that is almost cleaned, working skills and working combat and so on.
Thanks,
GeneralMax

item.title: Clean source and client
item.dc:creator: @ITI_Basak_ITI ITI Basak ITI
item.description:
@ITI_Basak_ITI wrote:

This is where Im at now, I was able to get it to find the server.ini. Why is it not recognizing these though? where do they need to be placed?

Im on a mac btw, so using the run.bat isn’t an option lol

Read full topic

item.title: Clean source and client
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

[quote=“ITI Basak ITI, post:9, topic:534816”]I’ve tried running your euthymia and I get this error. Any ideas why its not recognizing server.ini?[/quote]make the server locate the files
Btw have u tried the run.bat? i dont really remember if it worked… but u could try.

Read full topic

I dont know if my euthymia would be considered good but well i’ve told you some.

item.title: Clean source and client
item.dc:creator: @hands hands
item.description:
@hands wrote:

You do not have a items.cfg file. Just download one for your revision. This may link to your revision. If not, then google one http://www.mediafire.com/download/85497z1tij3sz7m/item.cfg+742%2F743+(New+bonuses)

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @ITI_Basak_ITI ITI Basak ITI
item.description:
@ITI_Basak_ITI wrote:

The source you just posted is what Im looking for.

When I run it with Eclipse IDE this is the Error I get. Any Idea’s?

item.title: Clean source and client
item.dc:creator: @Encryption Encryption
item.description:
@Encryption wrote:

Just place it in the user/“YOURCOMPUTERNAMEHERE” folder.

Read full topic

item.title: Clean source and client
item.dc:creator: @GeneralMaxz GeneralMaxz
item.description:
@GeneralMaxz wrote:

[quote=“Encryption, post:2, topic:534816”]Netty PI V2
http://www.mediafire.com/?4b5rd7fedsud76c


Client: http://www.mediafire.com/?5ofzsniaje5ds1s
Cache: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/61341997/cache.zip
External cache mirror: http://www.upload.ee/files/3229455/cache.zip.html

Unless you want a clean Hyperion based server.[/quote]
Thanks for the fast answer!
Can you teach me what to do with the cache? or is it autodownloading?

and also… can you tell me a good delta based source?

Read full topic
